result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevis R Walls was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Trevis R Walls is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Trevis R Walls was found guilty of 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • Trevis R Walls was found guilty of Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).
  • Trevis R Walls was found guilty of Incest with Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.06(1).
  • Trevis R Walls was found guilty of 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • Trevis R Walls was found guilty of Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).
  • Trevis R Walls was found guilty of Incest with Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.06(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: State shall have 60 days to determine.

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Pay restitution plus surcharges; the State shall have 60 days to determine restitution.  
May not have contact with any of the victims or anyone under the age of 18, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  Comply withsex offender programs & registry.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
\May not have contact with any of the victims or anyone under the age of 18, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  Comply with sex offender programs & registry,

Same appearances as on 1/30/18.  Jury instructions given by the Court.  Closing arguments made by counsel.  13th juror excused.  Deliberations began at 10:25 a.m.; verdicts reached at 10:55 a.m.  Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6 - Verdicts of guilty on each count.  Judgment entered on the verdicts.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 3/14/18 at 3:00.  Bond ordered revoked.

Same appearances as on 1/29/18.  Video played for jury.  State witnesses testified:  Det. Timothy Ives, S.G., and E.G.  Break for lunch.  State witness Det. Warren DenHartog testified.  State rests.  Defense rests without testimony of any witnesses.  Jury excused at 2:49 pm; to return on 1/31/18 at 9:00.  Bond continued.
Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges.

Attys Carli McNeill and Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Michael Barth.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  On motion of the State, initials of the victim in Counts 4, 5, and 6 are amended to EMG.  Counts 7, 8, and 9 are dismissed without prejudice on motion of the State.  Miranda-Goodchild hearing held.  Voir dire and selection of jurors from 9:25 to 10:45 a.m.; 13 jurors selected.  Jury instructions given by the Court and opening statements given by counsel.  Testimony of State witnesses E.G. and P. H. heard.  DVD of CAC interview re S.G. played for jury.  Court adjourned at 3:10 p.m.  Jury trial to continue 1/30/18 at 8:45.  Bond continued.
filed by Asst. D.A. Jason Zapf.

Attys Jason Zapf and Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Michael Barth.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  State filed their Other Acts motion on 10/2/17, well beyond time limits for filing.  The Court finds no excusable neglect for not filing on time, and will not entertain the Other Acts motion.  Case remains on for JS on 1/29/18 at 8:45.  Miranda-Goodchild hearing will be heard after the jury is selected.  Bond continued.
